description.narrative: Access to up to date textbooks and other materials is a key component of quality education. A review of Papua New Guinea (PNG) universities found that university students in PNG are inadequately prepared for university. A large part of this stems from inadequate facilities in secondary schools and national high schools. In 2009-10 procurement of textbooks and teaching materials took place which were delivered to all primary schools in PNG. This assistance only responded to part of the need for the educational materials in PNG. Much like the primary school procurement and distribution initiative (INI875) this funding is for Australian Government support to the PNG Education Sector for the purchase and distribution of textbooks and equipment to secondary schools across PNG. After AusAIDs success with INI875 the PNG Department of Education has requested that a similar strategy be employed to deliver an expected 500,000 books and other core resources during the first six months of 2011.
